_header: He that in youth no virtue used / In age all honor him refused
Note:
See 513, 1866, 2988, 5530 (lines 3-4,TCC), 6137, and 6647; cf. Tilley (1950)
XTilley, Morris Palmer. A Dictionary of the Proverbs in England in the 16th and 17th Centuries. Ann Arbor, MI: University of Michigan, 1950, Y 37; Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler ,TM 540.
_description: A proverb — one couplet, here isolated, also found incorporated into longer texts

BodAsh1146.Transcription:
He that in youth noe vertue will learnegoe like a lubber and throshe
                    in the bearue

Bod9.Transcription:
Who þat in ȝoute no vertue vseþIn age al honour hym
                    refuseþ
Bod9.Editions:
Schleich,  Gustav,
                        ed.  
             “Die sprichwörter Hendings und die Prouerbis of Wisdom.” 
             Anglia
         51 (1927): 220-77: 221.

BodHat51.Transcription: He that in yowthe no vert ssyll vsein age all honer will hym refuse
BodHat51.Note: Written early sixteenth century below ownership inscription of Harry Fawkener (see  2700.5, and fragment of this couplet written again on fol. 115rb, in left margin on fols. 168v and  179v.

BodLauMis656.Transcription:
he that In yowught no vertu wytt vseIn age all honur wyll hem refuse
                    & [ ]

BodRawC86.Transcription:
Who so in youthe no vertu vsithIn age all honour him
                    refusith

OxfBal354.Transcription:
He þat in yowth no vertu will useIn age all honour shall
                    Refuce
OxfBal354.Facsimiles:
Early Manuscripts at Oxford University: Facsimile
                    of Oxford, Balliol MS 354.
         (http://image.ox.ac.uk/show?collection=balliol&manuscript=ms354).
OxfBal354.Editions:
Flügel,  Ewald. 
             “Liedersammlungen des XVI Jahrhunderts….” 
             Anglia
         26 (1903): 94-285: 225.

OxfTri49.Editions:
Coxe,  Henry Octavius. 
             Catalogus codicum mss. qui in collegiis aulisque
                oxoniensibus….
         Oxon: e Typographeo academico, 1852: 20, rpr. Robbins (1955)
XRobbins,  Rossell Hope. 
             Secular Lyrics of the XIV and XV Centuries.
         2nd ed. Oxford: Clarendon, 1955254.
Manly,  John Matthews,  and  Edith Rickert, eds.  
             The Text of the Canterbury Tales studied on the basis of all known
                manuscripts.
         8 vols. Chicago: University of Chicago, 1940: 1.540.

CULFf530.Transcription:
He that in yought no vertu will vseIn age all honor will hem
                    refuyse
CULFf530.Note:
Second copy on this page; added end flyleaf, sixteenth-century
                    hand.

CULGg28.Transcription:
he that in yowthe no uertu wyll yowesin aege all honor shall hym
                    refuse
CULGg28.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope,
                        ed.  
             Secular Lyrics of the XIV and XV Centuries.
         2nd ed. Oxford: Clarendon, 1955: 81, xxxxii.
Luria,  Maxwell Sidney,  and  Richard L. Hoffman, eds.  
             Middle English Lyrics.
         New York: Norton, 1974: 121.

CULKk15.Transcription:
h quha þat in ȝewith n[ ] wssatIn old all honor
                    [ ]
CULKk15.Note: Cropped right edge; added by later hand to lower margin.

CamGon433.Transcription:
He that in yought no vertue will usein age all goodnes will hym
                    refuse

BLRoy17Dvi.Transcription: He that in yowthe no vertu wyll vsein Age alle honer wylle hym refuse…
BLRoy17Dvi.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of British Library Royal MS 17 D VI.
         https://www.bl.uk/manuscripts/FullDisplay.aspx?index=0&ref=Royal_MS_17_D_VI.

BLRoy17Dxviii.Transcription:
He that in yought to no vertew himselfe appliethIn age to amende him
                    badd costome deniethe
BLRoy17Dxviii.Note:
Sixteenth century.
                    Added to lower
                    margin after end of Hoccleve’s Regiment of Princes (3581).
BLRoy17Dxviii.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope,
                        ed.  
             Secular Lyrics of the XIV and XV Centuries.
         2nd ed. Oxford: Clarendon, 1955: 254.

DULCosViii9.Transcription:
He that in yowthe no vartwe well uesin age all honor will hym
                    Refuse
DULCosViii9.Note: Added to top margin; followed by 512.5.
DULCosViii9.Facsimiles:
Burrow,  John,  and  A. I. Doyle, eds.  
             Thomas Hoccleve: A Facsimile of the Autograph Verse
                Manuscripts.
EETS
         s.s. 19 (2002).
DULCosViii9.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.   Hoccleve’s Works: The Minor Poems. vol. 1.  EETS
         e.s. 61 (1892); repr. with Gollancz (1925)
XGollancz,  Israel. 
             Hoccleve’s Works: The Minor Poems. vol. 2.  EETS
         e.s. 73 (1925); repr. with 61, 1970 73; rev. J.
            Mitchell and A. Ian Doyle, 1970: 218.

GULHun400.Transcription:
In youthe wha will nor vertu vsein Age all honor will hym
                    Reffuse

NottsULMeLm1.Transcription:
Whoso in youthe no vertu vsethIn age al honour hym
                    refuseth

HunHM502.Transcription:
He that In youthe no vertu wyll UseIn age all honur wyll haym
                    refues
HunHM502.Note:
Written as prose; added after end, ‘so be It‘; with
                    signature above, ‘John Wood’.
HunHM502.Editions:
Schulz,  Herbert. C., Norma B. Cuthbert,   and  Naydée Noya.  
             Ten Centuries of Manuscripts in the Huntington Library.
         San Marino, CA: Huntington Library, 1962: 15-16.
Dutschke,  C. W. 
             Guide to Medieval and Renaissance Manuscripts in the Huntington
                Library.
         2 vols. San Marino, CA: Huntington Library, 1989: 1.238.
